intro: Anil strobilifera, commonly known as the Indian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its feathery leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is known for its unique underground tubers, which are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Anil strobilifera thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert and semi-desert environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of arid ecosystems.
